derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English midhrif, from mid + hrif 'belly'

entry.tran: 上腹部(胸与腰之间的部分)
entry.def: Someone's midriff is the middle part of their body, between their waist and their chest.

means.word_mean: 1. the middle area of the human torso (usually in front);

sentences.sentence: "young American women believe that a bare midriff is fashionable"

means.word_mean: 2. (anatomy) a muscular partition separating the abdominal and thoracic cavities; functions in respiration
